name: A question regarding some new build possibilities
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
As you may (or may not, accordingly) know, BeamDog made it possible to finally create custom Spellbooks for Classes in NWN:EE.

A hak has been made to bring spellbooks to the PrCs of Harper Scout, Blackguard, and Assassin, bringing them inline with their PnP counterparts.

Aside from Blackguard here, the spells of both Harper Scout and Assassin are Arcane in nature, meaning that it actually qualifies them for the following PrCs:

Arcane Archer
Red Dragon Disciple
Pale Master

In light of this, how does the ECB feel about expanding builds to account for this?

As of right now, it is possible to put this hak into Mods and/or PWs (barring some difficulties, such as those with modified Class .2das).  This means that yes, peeps will be able to build using these methods (might need some additional work, accordingly).

Still, I personally find this really, really exciting!  New building blocks!  Oh my oh my!

I haven't been this excited since HotU came out!

The hak in question : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/ ... earchtext=

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:

However (and you knew there'd be a however), and others may well have different views, we're still supposed to focus on vanilla NwN here, so I can't buy into it as a norm. But (please note the lack of a 'however') if requests are made for such a build, that could be fun. Just not a Full Epic forum one. At least for now.

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like the idea of spellbooks for these classes.
If nothing else, we must follow up on how the new hak works and see how popular it becomes.
If the hak replaces the spell-like abilities, we must know if the stacking of the ability buffing spells such as BG Bull's, HS Cat's and Eagle's is out or if it's still there.
The ability stat for casting also becomes an issue now for low wisdom BGs. Assassins normally have a high intelligence while HSs may or may not have a high charisma.
It is a good question if the Assassin and HS classes now are programmed to count as a arcane casters. That could indeed open up a whole new avenue of AA and PM builds. As for RDD, I assume that you still need a class associated with Dragon blood, such as Bard and Sorcerer.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
The Hak does not replace the spell like abilities (so that it does not break backwards compatibility) but does make them "non-operative" - meaning that the new spellbooks take precedence.

I also made a mistake regarding Assassin and RDD - since Assassins have to memorize spells like Wizards, they are not a "spontaneous spellcaster" and therefore do not have the requirements for RDD (sorc and bard).

I would also like to point out that this Hak utilizes normal, ingame menus, etc - meaning it does not need any other support here.  In other words, it is using vanilla assets.

This is what is exciting imo.  It actually is inline with the "vanilla assets only" rule.
